items.text: back of a length outside off, pushed to point off the back foot
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Moor, no run

items.text: back of a length on leg stump, pushed through square leg off the back foot
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Moor, 1 run

items.text: full outside off, sliced to point on the front foot
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: back of a length at off stump, makes room and cuts it to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: tossed up on off stump, leans in and drives to long-off
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Moor, 1 run

items.text: oh this close on the lbw appeal. Length ball sliding and catching him in the crease in front of middle and leg. Mortaza gives it out. He doesn't have a review left
items.postText: Ball tracking shows that would have gone over leg stump. Good decision.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Moor, no run

items.text: length outside off, chopped to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Moor, 1 run

items.text: shot. This is a length ball that sits up for him outside off and he moves his weight onto the back foot quickly to hammer it to the midwicket boundary
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sikandar Raza, FOUR runs

items.text: length and coming in at leg stump, pushed into the vacant midwicket region
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: short ball at an off stump line, arches backwards to let it pass
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Moor, no run

items.text: a bouncer. This one more short and more steep. He drops his wrists and lets it go
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Moor, no run

items.text: tossed up on leg stump, swept straight to short fine
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: good length on middle stump, dead-batted on the front foot
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Sikandar Raza, no run

items.text: good length at middle stump, swept to deep square
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: given out lbw. Slides past his inside edge and strikes him in front of middle stump. He was looking to defend for the turn and completely missed the line of this slider. Huge gap between bat and pad
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Moor, OUT

dismissal.text: PJ Moor lbw b Sunzamul Islam 14 (42b 1x4 0x6) SR: 33.33

items.text: lbw review. Waller has looked to play the paddle sweep first up and missed it. Looks to be struck on a middle stump line. The ball hasn't risen too much. I reckon the only way he survives this is if he has got bat or glove on it. We're waiting for Ultra Edge...no bat involved. Tracking has him dead in front. That's hitting middle and off. He's gone.
items.postText: Graeme Cremer has come out to face the hat-trick ball. Slip, gully, short leg and leg slip around him.
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Waller, OUT

dismissal.text: MN Waller lbw b Sunzamul Islam 0 (1b 0x4 0x6) SR: 0.00

items.text: tossed up outside off stump, driven straight to extra cover
items.postText: Just got word that if Bangladesh bowl Zimbabwe out for less than 172, they'll pick up another bonus point.
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Cremer, no run

items.text: short and wide outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: short and wide outside off, cut to point off the toe-end of the bat
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Cremer, no run

items.text: short and wide outside off, under-edges the cut into the point region
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Cremer, no run

items.text: back of a length and in at off stump, tapped to extra cover on the up
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Cremer, no run

items.text: short and in the corridor, mistimed pull to mid-on
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Cremer, no run

items.text: back of a length in the corridor, wafts inside the line and is beaten on the outside edge
items.postText:
Zahid Hossain: "Phil Simmons bowled 8 maidens out of 10 in an ODI against Pakistan. His figures: 10-8-3-4 ! Game link"

Zeeshan Mahmud: "PV Simmons possibly? He was man of the match for his spell. Note: Simmons' figures establish a new record for one-day internationals. Betters BS Bedi's 12-8-6-1 (v E.Africa, Headingley, 11 Jun 1975)" --- Yeah it could well be Simmons, but the lack of ball-by-ball data there makes it tough to verify. The record he broke, of course, was for the most economical spell in ODIs.
items.shortText: Rubel Hossain to Cremer, no run

items.text: floated up outside off, leans in and squeezes it through the covers on the front foot
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Sikandar Raza, 1 run

items.text: full at off stump, driven back to the bowler
items.shortText: Sunzamul Islam to Cremer, no run
